mdRecord.dcterms:title: Pocket surgical instrument set
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Francis Arnold & Son [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: This instrument was owned by Dr. James E. Copeland (1845-1937) of Round Hill, Virginia. It was donated to the University of Virginia by Copeland's grandson, Edward V. Copeland, in 1971. Contained in leather and metal case with the following text on the leather: "J.E. Copeland, M.D."; set includes: female catheter; forceps- metal, Daily and Arnold; bistoury with curved sharp point - plastic and metal, F. AR[_]& Son; aneurism needle- plastic and metal, F.Arnold & Son; finger knife - plastic and metal, F.Arnold & Son; scalpel - plastic and metal; bistoury with curved probe point - plastic and metal; tenaculum - plastic and metal; probe - sterling; male catheter - metal; abscess lancet - plastic and metal; spatula - metal; fabric thread; 2 cards of Surgeons' twisted silk suture No. 2 and No. 7, Seabury & Johnson, Seabury Pharmacal Laboratories, New York; Surgeon's silk suture No. 2, Fayette manufacturing company, Baltimore Maryland, genuine chinese tsatlee; plaster; two prescription labels - paper, Dr. JE Copeland, Round Hill, Virginia.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments and apparatus
